headline: Classic Waffles
description: These crispy waffles are easy to make with simple ingredients you probably already have on hand for a light and fluffy breakfast treat.

video.description: Wake up to a classic breakfast treat.

name: Classic Waffles

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, baking powder and sugar; set aside. Preheat waffle iron to desired temperature.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture; beat until blended.
Ladle the batter into a preheated waffle iron. Cook the waffles until golden and crisp. Serve immediately.

NEVER TOO SALTY when you use UNSALTED butter. If you're using salted butter, do not add more salt. The author of this recipe likely assumed people would know this but many do not. I have tried many waffle recipes & this is BY FAR THE BEST!!! After reading reviews, here is what I did differently: 1) I used UNSALTED BUTTER! Many complaints about waffles being TOO SALTY There's a very high probability that they used salted butter plus added salt according to recipe. The salt content in butter is oftentimes very high & adding more salt will make for too Salty waffles. This is true for any recipe because there's no way to know how much salt is in the butter. 2) I added a squeeze of lemon juice to my warn milk. 3) I added a small dash of both cinnamon & nutmeg to batter, each less than 1/8 teaspoon.
